18600000.text: There are Thiefhogs that have developed a taste for sprouts, and the damage they've done to the crops is severe. Please get rid of those Leaf Thiefhogs.

18600001.text: I'm worried that there are too many Blue Hermit Crabs at the Shallow Lake. They are omnivorous and will eat anything. Reduce their number before they consume everything in the Lake.

18600002.text: The Thiefhogs at Shallow Lake have stolen all the bait for fishing. Please deal with these pesky Fish Thiefhogs.

18600003.text: There are people who eat the Snakecap without knowing that it's poisonous. Go the to Shallow Lake and get rid of the Snakecaps before there are any more victims.

18600004.text: The Lilybads at the Shallow Lake are very ferocious. There are numerous cases of people approaching them, thinking they're simply lotus leaves, and then getting attacked. Eliminate the Lilybads so that no more people get hurt.

18600005.text: Every time I purchase a crab, the Thiefhogs come and steal it. They ran away to the Shallow Lake. Please punish those thieves. You'll find them easily because they'll be wearing those crabs on their heads.

18600006.text: The Sting Lilybads at the Shallow Lake are troubling the merchants coming to the Fishbelly Pub. Defeat the Lilybads and help the merchants.

18600007.text: The foxes in the hills surrounding the Shallow Lake are known to steal bundles from travelers. Please punish the foxes for their mischief.

18600008.text: We need to plant trees again in the Rotten Lumber Camp, but the Ratmen are interfering with our work. Eliminate the Ratman Warriors roaming around near the trees.

18600009.text: The people who have been to the Rotten Lumber Camp keep getting sick. Since there could be an epidemic caused by the Ratmen, we have to keep that from happening. Please eliminate the Ratman Archers.

18600010.text: The Ratmen at the Rotten Lumber Camp have killed innocent people. Eliminate the Ratmen and avenge the people they killed.

18600011.text: The fisheries at Turtle Lake are having trouble because of the turtles in the area. Hunt the Lake Turtle and reduce their number.

18600012.text: There are some turtles at Turtle Lake that refuse to budge even an inch from where they are! Please deal with those Heavy Lake Turtles.

18600013.text: The Barren Ruins is filled with Enraged Escort Swordsmen. Their large number poses a serious threat. Please eliminate them.

18600014.text: There's no end to the number of Enraged Escort Gunners coming out of the Barren Ruins. Reduce their numbers to keep them from crossing the Shallow Lake.

18600015.text: Eliminate all the Enraged Escort Swordsmen, Enraged Escort Gunners, Elite Enraged Escort Swordsmen and Elite Enraged Escort Gunners. These Enraged Protectors might be quiet for now, but they could attack the village at any moment.

18600016.text: Enraged Protectors have appeared at the Ruins and are posing a threat. Help defeat these Enraged Escort Swordsmen, Enraged Escort Gunners, or Elite Enraged Protectors so that they won't be a danger anymore.

18600017.text: The awful Blue Bandit Blade Masters and Dual Blades Wielders have set up camp in the forest and are driving people away from there. Please go and take care of the Blue Bandits.

18600018.text: The Blue Bandits are growing day by day, and more people are suffering because of them. Go to the Blue Bandits Camp and eliminate the Blue Bandit Blade Masters and Dual Blades Wielders, so their looting won't be a problem anymore.

18600019.text: Go to the Blue Bandits Camp and eliminate the Blue Bandits Zen Archers and Warlords who are terrorizing innocents. Please also eliminate the Elite Blue Bandits Warlords and Zen Archers. If the Blue Bandits are left alone, they'll grow into a greater threat in the future.

18600020.text: They say many avoid the Highland Central Trail because of the Tree Spirits, and there's even those who hold rituals in hopes of escaping the misfortune of running into an Elite Tree Spirit. Please defeat the Tree Spirits for those who are too afraid to travel the trail.

18600022.text: Eliminate the saberfangs at the Highland Central Trail. At this rate, the stags and goats will disappear because of those saberfangs.

18600023.text: Travelers can't use the Highland Central Trail because of the Tree Spirits. Please help those terrified travelers.

18600024.text: The natives near the Poacher Gang Base have lost their homes because of the Poacher Gang. Go eliminate the Poacher Gang Blade Masters or Archers and bring them to justice.

18600025.text: There have been more cases of people getting attacked by the Poacher Gang. Go to the Poacher Gang Base and stop the Poacher Gang so that they can't commit any more atrocities. Please eliminate the Poacher Gang Blade Masters, Zen Archers, Assassins, Force Masters, and Elite Poacher Gang Axe Warriors.

18600026.text: The Poacher Gang are notorious for their cruelty, and among them, the Poacher Gang Assassins are exceptionally notorious. Eliminate them.

18600027.text: The people's suffering caused by the Poacher Gang's illegal smuggling is no small matter. Go to the Poacher Gang Base and teach those Poacher Gang Force Masters a lesson or two.

18600028.text: There's a rumor circulating that spiders have appeared at the Deep Forest Graveyard and are digging up the graves. Go and eliminate the spiders before the ghosts come out of their resting places.

18600029.text: They say if you take one step into the Deep Forest Graveyard, a Mature Spirit appears, and on the second step, a Child Spirit appears, bewitching and kidnapping the person. Drive away the Mature Spirit and Child Spirit so that they can't bewitch people.

18600030.text: That Dokkaebi is so scary. How could you not be afraid when we don't have a clue what kind of weird magic it could cast? I really wish that the Dokkaebi would just disappear. Go to the Deep Forest Graveyard and deal with the Dokkaebi.

18600031.text: The livestock at Sunset Pasture can't graze there because they're afraid of the Gnarloxes. Go and help them.

18600032.text: The Scarlet Bulbari are consuming the grass at Sunset Pasture, and there's not enough grass for the livestock. Get rid of the Bulbari.

18600033.text: Do you know that there's gold in the meadow of Sunset Pasture? The Perfect Golden Bulbari has a shining golden leaf. Obtain a golden leaf, and the gold from it can be put to good use.

18600034.text: Eliminate the bears at the Rocky Hill. I'm way too terrified to go there myself.

18600035.text: Why are there so many saberfangs at the Rocky Hill? Eliminate the saberfangs roaming the Rocky Hill.

18600036.text: The bears and saberfangs at the Rocky Hill are reputed to be strong and terrifying. They attack not only animals, but also people, too. Someone has to get rid of these beasts.

18600037.text: The Consumed Ratmen are contaminating the Destroyed Ploggle Village with germs. Eliminate the Consumed Ratmen for the sake of hygiene.

18600038.text: The Ploggles are suffering because of the Consumed Ratmen at the Destroyed Ploggle Village. Eliminate the Ratmen for the safety of the Ploggles.

18600039.text: The Ploggles have been having a hard time ever since the Consumed Ratmen appeared at the Destroyed Ploggle Village. Now, things are even tougher for them after the crocodiles showed up. Eliminate the Consumed Ratmen and crocodiles and help the Ploggles.

18600040.text: There has been a sudden increase in the number of Blue Hermit Crabs, and this is causing trouble for the fisheries. Get rid of the Blue Hermit Crabs near the Washed-Up Ship Debris.

18600041.text: More and more people are getting injured by the Swamp Crocodile at the Creepy Valley. Help the people out so that they won't be harmed anymore.

18600042.text: The Bottomless Pit has become uninhabitable because of the Hollows. Eliminate the Hollows.

18600043.text: The Hollows that roam as empty, soulless shells must be eliminated. Go to the Bottomless Pit and eliminate the Hollows.

18600044.text: Hollows are still appearing endlessly at the Bottomless Pit. Because of the non-stop fighting, everyone, including those who were not harmed by them, have gripped by fear. Eliminate the Hollows and Elite Hollows for the sake of the people.

18600501.text: The mushroom on the back of a Jungle Bulbari must be a Poisoncap. Somebody nearly died from eating it not long ago. Eliminate the Jungle Bulbaries at the Cobweb Forest Trail before someone else gets poisoned by that mushroom.

18600502.text: There's a surprising number of spiders at the Cobweb Forest Trail. They say there used to be so many spiders that their cobwebs blocked out the sunlight. Their numbers still need to be whittled down, so please eliminate some of the spiders.

18600503.text: The Cobweb Forest Trail is a path that leads to the East Ecological Research Site, but the Mandarava are wreaking havoc there. It'd help us a lot if you could eliminate them.

18600504.text: Safety at the East Ecological Research Site has improved, but there are still pioneers who fall prey to the Jungle Bears. We must hunt down the bears if we want to prevent any more victims.

18600505.text: The pattern of the bear and saberfang leather at the East Ecological Research Site is very unique. The leather itself is high quality, too. It'll attract a lot of interest back in our homeland. I'll look forward to you bringing me some quality material.

18600506.text: I want to use jungle stag bones to develop an epidemic treatment, but these stags are so ferocious that I can't get close to them. Could you hunt Jungle Stags for me? I'd like to collect and study their bones.

18600507.text: The Jungle Bulbaries also add to the noise when the Mandaravas start getting loud, as if they're singing along. It's noisy enough with just the Mandaravas, and the Jungle Bulbaries make it worse. Eliminate the Jungle Bulbaries in front of the Mandarava Waterfall.

18600508.text: It's fortunate that the noisy Mandaravas are at the waterfall, but we don't know when they might come over to Dojung Port. Stop the Mandaravas from coming over.

18600509.text: It is difficult to pass through Mandara Falls because of the noisy Mandaravas. This problem can only be solved if all the Small Mandaravas, Mandaravas, and Elite Mandaravas are eliminated. Please get rid of the Small Mandaravas, Mandaravas and Elite Mandaravas.

18600510.text: The Jungle Wolves are terrifying creatures that most people dread running into. Eliminate the wolves so that the people at Opulent Forest Base can travel without fear.

18600511.text: The Opulent Forest Base is an important location for the pioneers, but there are also a lot of Greenhorns, which are a source of trouble. Eliminate them so that they don't come over to the Opulent Forest Base.

18600512.text: People say that the flower on top of the head of the Stem Bulbari is good for treating poison, but the rumor simply isn't true. Eliminate the Stem Bulbari so that people don't fall for that lie.

18600513.text: Have you seen Shore Bulbaries' navy leaves? They're very beautiful. I sent some baskets made of them to Moonwater Harbor and received a positive response. I'd like to make more baskets. Please bring me the Bulbari leaves.

18600514.text: The Shore Hermit Crabs are increasing rapidly at the Abandoned Watchtower. We must investigate the cause, but reducing their numbers is the more urgent issue for now. Please help.

18600515.text: The area around the Abandoned Watchtower is stable for now, but that could change any time. Please clear it of monsters.

18600516.text: Go to the Shipwreck Debris and eliminate the Shore Turtles. Take care of them before the shore is covered with turtles.

18600517.text: The Shipwreck Debris in front of the Opulent Forest Base should be cleared away, but the Oduksinis in the area make it dangerous for us to do that. Eliminate the Tall Oduksinis or Elite Slowpoke Oduksinis.

18600518.text: We failed to retrieve some valuables from the Shipwreck, and we think Little Oduksinis might have taken them. Could you check them out?

18600519.text: Taero Forest has many settlers, and most of them will go anywhere to make a living. Eliminate the Shore Crocodiles so that they don't get hurt.

18600520.text: There isn't a single spot where there aren't any hermit crabs! Please keep those hermit crabs from increasing in number. They're breeding out of control!

18600521.text: Some Blue Bandits wander about the Ship Graveyard like ghosts. Whatever their reason is for being there, they're not helping us reclaim the area. Please stop them.

18600522.text: The Mandarava are making the Windpath Valley impassable. It's simply unbearable to take even just one step towards all that racket! Take care of the Mandarava so we can use the path again.

18600523.text: The horns of the Darkhorns are huge and hard, which make them a good material for weapons. If you could get some horns from the Darkhorns in the valley, I'll see if I can turn them into some weapons.

18600524.text: Bears in the Windpath Valley are notorious for their ferociousness. Please get rid of Valley Bears for the settlers' sake.

18600525.text: All kinds of shellfish are attached to the shells of the Beach Turtle, and when you're lucky, you can find a shellfish pearl. Collect the shellfish pearls from the shells of the Beach Turtles. Accessories made from the pearls can be very popular.

18600526.text: The Beach Bulbaries have made their way up to the Northern Side Trail of Dojung Port. They usually stay near the shore, but it seems they've been driven out by the Oduksinis. Please eliminate them so that they don't enter Dojung Port.

18600527.text: Everyone's tools are disappearing. Soul Steel, Peach Blossom, everybody's been losing them. Only the Oduksinis would do this. Retrieve our tools for us.

18600528.text: The Oduksinis love shiny materials. That's why they hoard so many pearls. Since they keep stealing our things at Dojung Port, it'll be fine if we take some of those pearls for ourselves. Please collect pearls that the Shore Oduksinis have hoarded.

18600529.text: The Scarlet Masks are taming the Forest Wolves. Eliminate the Forest Wolves at the Forest of the Scarlet Masks so that the Scarlet Masks can't tame them anymore.

18600530.text: Most of the merchants receive the goods at Dojung Port and transport them to different settlements. The Scarlet Masks keep robbing them of their cargo and even their lives. Go to the Forest of the Scarlet Masks and eliminate them.

18600531.text: We must let the outside world know that the Taero Forest is fraught with the Scarlet Masks. How about we send out their red masks as evidence? Please collect masks from Scarlet Masks Scouts, Scarlet Masks Assassins, Scarlet Masks Zen Archers, and Elite Scarlet Masks Destroyers.

18600532.text: The Misty Spitting Plants have been attacking people who pass by the Shadowed Mistwood. Eliminate the Misty Spitting Plants to promote their safety.

18600533.text: The Soul Steel Leader Moonwind has appeared at the Shadowed Mistwood, but it looks like there's a group of them. They have to be illusions. Eliminate those Illusion Moonwinds so that the people won't be deceived.

18600534.text: Horyong, the leader of the Merchants, has appeared at the Shadowed Mistwood. It must actually be a monster created from illusions. Eliminate the Illusion Horyong so that no one is deceived.

18600535.text: The crocodiles in the Shadowed Mistwood are so aggressive that if left alone, they will become a threat to the settlers living there. Go and eliminate the Misty Crocodiles at the Shadowed Mistwood.

18600536.text: Just the fact that the swamp is drying out is worrying enough, and now its water is getting murkier by the day. I don't know why it's evaporating, but I know what's agitating its water: the Lilybads. Please stop them from further contaminating the water in the Disappearing Swamp.

18600537.text: Beasts are the worst threats to the powerless settlers. Eliminate the crocodiles at the Disappearing Swamp to help the people there.

18600538.text: The Illusion Mantises mimic the most powerful being they've come across, and they use their illusions to lure the settlers. Eliminate the Illusion Mantises so that they can't hurt anyone.

18600539.text: Mehwa, the master of the Plum Blossom, has reportedly appeared at the Disappearing Swamp, but that can't be possible. If it is an illusion, eliminate it immediately. And get rid of any Illusion Mantis you see while you're there. You never know what they might turn into.

18600540.text: The Snakecaps at the Snakecap Field spit hallucinogenic substances into the air. Take care of those dangerous Snakecaps.

18600541.text: Spitting Plants are spreading across the Snakecap Field. It's never a good idea to let monsters like that flourish. Please weed out Field Spitting Plants.

18600542.text: Mantises have appeared at the Snakecap Field. Eliminate the Mushroom Illusion Mantises before they mimic another person and harm others. While you're at it, it would be of great help if you could also destroy the Snakecaps which release a mind-altering substance into the air.

18600543.text: There's a Pioneers' Graveyard to commemorate the early pioneers who died. Clear the Grave Spitting Plants so that they may rest in peace.

18600544.text: There are Souls roaming the Pioneers' Graveyard. Could it be that these souls can't rest because their duty during their life was to explore Taero Forest? Help the Mature Souls and Child Souls rest in peace.

18600545.text: We have a request, since there's an obstacle towards the development of the Tranquil Woods. I'll be grateful if you can deal with the Moss Fox and help us in developing the land.

18600546.text: Have you seen those turtles with sharp shells? They look very dangerous. Drive away the Simyu Turtles for the sake of the development of the Tranquil Woods.

18600547.text: People keep mistaking Spitting Plants in the Nepenthes Marsh for beautiful flowers and getting attacked. There's only one viable solution. Eliminate the Marsh Spitting Plants.

18600548.text: Crocodiles are appearing in the Nepenthes Marsh. Please help us exterminate Berserk Marsh Crocodiles.

18600549.text: The Marsh Nepenthes emits powerful toxic substances and has harmed countless settlers. Please get rid of the Marsh Nepenthes for their sake.

18600550.text: Simyu Sentinels and Simyu Throwers attacked the settlers on Simyu Hill. We cannot turn a blind eye towards their attacks. Please protect the settlers from the Simyu Sentinels and Simyu Throwers.

18600551.text: The Simyu tribe makes rice cakes with the white flowers growing on Simyu Hill, and those cakes are supposedly effective against the disease. Maybe we should check out the rice cakes they carry with them. Please collect some of the Simyu's rice cakes.

18600552.text: If we could use the abundant water on Simyu Hill as drinking water or for farming, it'll be a great help to the settlers. However, I'm worried that the Waterfall Bulbaries and Waterfall Lilybads could contaminate the water. I trust you to take care of them.

18600553.text: How about we prepare some nutritious food for the hardworking settlers? Stags on the Grassland Knoll can provide tender, protein-rich meat. Could you bring me their venison?

18600554.text: The leaves of the Hill Bulbari are shiny and durable, which make them a good crafting material. If you could collect some Hill Bulbari leaves, I can try to develop various crafts. Who knows? I just might be able to develop a new specialty for Taero Forest!

18600555.text: Eliminate the spiders at the Grassland Knoll. They are attacking those passing by the Grassland Knoll, treating them as their prey. Help the settlers by eliminating the Grassland Spiders.

18600556.text: Botanists want to check the stomach contents of Grassland Gnarloxes to find out why there are no trees at the Grassland Knoll. Could you get some intestines for them?

18600557.text: It's a disaster! The Simyu Mandaravas at the Misty Plateau next to the Herbalists' Territory are multiplying in number! We can't have all these noisy Mandaravas near a place where people should be able to rest! The herbalists won't be able to relax at all because of that racket. Please go and silence the Mandaravas, even if it means eliminating them all.

18600558.text: Do you know what knows herbs in Taero Forest best? It's the Simyu Roc. If you go to the place that the Simyu Roc is interested in, there's always herbs to be found. It's easy to find herbs if you use this fact to your advantage. Please collect herbs from the Simyu Roc.

18600559.text: The Herbalists' Territory has a great view, but it's very small. There's a wider area if you go down a little from there, and it's also quiet since there are fewer Mandaravas. We could build a village there if we drive away the Simyu foxes, Simyu goats, and Simyu forest turtles. Please lend us your strength.

18600560.text: The Lapriels on Sunrise Climb keep stealing and destroying the development materials that the settlers have collected. They may not want change, but the settlers need them. Please drive the Lapriels away from Sunrise Climb.

18600561.text: The settlers are looking for stag skin to craft leather. The Sunrise Stag makes the best leather, which is tough but very smooth. If you could gather Sunrise Stag leather, it would definitely help the lives of the settlers.

18600562.text: The Sunrise Tree Spirits and Lapriel are a source of concern for the herbalists of Sunrise Climb since they keep them from gathering herbs. Get rid of the Sunrise Tree Spirits and Lapriel for the herbalists.

18600563.text: It's dark in the Blackened Mudlands, even during the daytime. Countless pioneers ventured inside and never returned because of the crocodiles lurking there. Please get rid of those dangerous creatures so no more lives will be sacrificed.

18600564.text: Eliminate the Mud Turtles of the Blackened Mudlands. They lay dormant in the mud and ferociously attack when they're bothered even a little bit. Several people have already been injured. Protect the people from these Mud Turtles.

18600565.text: Mud spiders keep getting in the way of the pioneers in the Blackened Mudlands. Please exterminate them and help the pioneers navigate their way around the place.

18600566.text: The Spider Forest Path is a useful route to the Eastern Ecological Forest, but the mandala doesn't take too much time. Get rid of the mandala. It will definitely be of great help.

18600567.text: You probably know that our Geumgyeongcheolmun refines minerals in the new continent and sends them to various places. But the Myomyeon people have been looting the minerals they have mined for a while. I can't deliver any more good stuff. Let's help keep the Myomyeon from disturbing us.

18600568.text: In front of Mandala Falls is an important transport route for goods, which transporters are reluctant to go because mandalas are noisy and waterfall bears are dangerous. The request to ensure safety should not be ignored. Mandala flowers in front of Mandala Falls If you kill Wa Falls Bear, I will reward you.

18600569.text: We Ereda, as Rift Specialists, are constantly investigating the Rift and collecting biosamples from the Rift area to gather information about what has changed. So, I'd like to ask the small gorge for a biosample in front of Mandala Falls. We always have to keep an eye on what the impact is.

18600570.text: I told you the coastal turtle! I said that thieves appeared in the abandoned watchtower! I said more and more will come! Go ahead and immobilize the thieves!

18600571.text: It is said that there are people who go to the shore and are captured by the demons. Please go to the tomb of the shipwreck and drive the demons away so that the innocent are not endangered.

18600572.text: Bring me the weapons the demons have. It's dangerous, but it's worth examining how their weapons were made. Oh, I hope they're undamaged. They must be in good condition to investigate.

18600573.text: Information about the shipwreck is lacking. Where did the wrecked verses come from, and why they came to the sea and moon continent… But I would like to know, but I can't investigate further because of the threatening verses. If you slay the demons, you will help widen the great intellectual curiosity of mankind.

18600574.text: We are examining the tomb of a wreck in Dohwajeon. We need to find out whether the wreck was a passenger or cargo ship, and what items it was carrying. Will you? Lend me your hand. I'll take care of the reward.

18600575.text: Now is not the time to be carefree! We need to find out why all the crew members on the shipwreck have turned into guinea pigs! Maybe they ate black and blue herbs! If that's true, that's a big deal! Go and find out! Go to the wreck's grave!

18600576.text: Why did the spear gang appear on the shoreless shore? It seems only they know what the spear gang is up to. They probably have a note with the plan written on it. Gather the notes, I'll figure out the plan!

18600577.text: Some time ago, a band of thieves attacked our cargo ship and suffered great damage. It seems that the Spearmen of the Footless Shore are the same bandits that appeared on our cargo ship. We never know when we'll come back with our weapons ready. , we need to aim now. Go ahead and kill the bandits.

18600578.text: We ereda are constantly investigating cracks. Cracks have recently appeared on the shores without any footprints, so we're trying to figure out how the surrounding creatures are affected. Will be.

18600579.text: Myunghyedan is trying to figure out what kind of evil the bloodthirsty is doing. There is nothing more important in this barren frontier than understanding the dynamics of the evil swarm. Please find out what the bloodthief is doing.

18600580.text: Until now, there have been no cases of rifts in the Forest of Bloodbloods. However, recently, rumors have been circulating that Bloodbloods are gathering in the forest to open the rifts. The movements of the Bloodbrutes and the forest wolves that follow them are suspicious. Please go and check them out yourself.

18600581.text: We are planning to erect a monument to the pioneers of Taerokrim in the cemetery to commemorate the achievements of the pioneers of the Taerokrim.

18600582.text: Blood tablets appeared in the Pioneer Memorial Cemetery! They came to a place that commemorates the souls of those who pioneered Taerok Forest and stealing!

18600583.text: We, Geumgyeongcheolmun, are not the people who do anything profitably. Please note that we do not hand over our equipment to the unclean. They say that the Corrupted Recruiters in the forest are carrying our equipment. Retrieve the equipment from them. Recover the equipment I intend to return the value to the ram as much as I did.

18600584.text: I heard that the corrupt foster care team members have gathered in Jojiyo Forest. We have been pioneering Taerok Forest together since the early days, but we can't just watch them fall. Please go to the forest. Please help us to mow by eradicating it.

18600585.text: Some of the foster members who should take the lead in reclaiming the Taerok Forest have forgotten their duties and are engrossed in making profits. They are gathered in the forest at the same time, so it is an appropriate time to punish the corrupt. Let's eradicate those who pollute!

18600586.text: In Dohwajeon, we are closely examining the mud in the black mud zone. The study that the secret to maintaining a prosperous forest is fertile mud is very interesting. To verify this is true, we need a clay sample. I'd like to. I'll give you the pay so you won't be disappointed.

18600587.text: It's a pity that the Black Mud Zone is only famous for mud. There are so many stories to talk about, including crocodiles, turtles, and bald eagles! I need your help. I'd appreciate it if you could clear up the wild animals in the Black Mud.

18600588.text: The Black Mud Zone is a very dangerous place for ordinary settlers, but more and more people are going in without knowing it and are getting feces. Killing the Mud Crocodiles, Mud Turtles, Mud Spiders and Mushrooms in the Black Mud Zone will make it much safer than it is now. Same. Please help.

18600589.text: Originally, our barongs communicate well with wild animals. But for a while, they have been unable to communicate with animals from the black mud. They keep getting angry and attacking. Hmmm, there must be something wrong with their body! I want you to save me!

18601001.text: The Ivory Gale Haewol Quarters is being threatened by an increasing number of Hoglins along the Crimson Forest Path and the Red Slope. Please stop those on the Red Slope from expanding their territory.

18601002.text: How about we create specialty products with all of that Green Bristlegrass that the Mandaravas carry? I'm thinking cat toys. Cat owners would love them. First off, why don't you bring some Green Bristlegrass to me?

18601003.text: Wild animals appear along the Crimson Forest Path, attacking the settlers. Eliminate the wolves for the sake of the people's safety.

18601004.text: The red buds on the Red-Antlered Stags are effective for curing the pandemic, but they're too expensive for many settlers to afford. Would you be so kind as to procure some red buds? We'll use them to help those in need.

18601005.text: I'm worried that the Hoglins will settle and create a tribe at the Crimson Forest Path. Can we let a Hoglin tribe live right in front of the great Ivory Gale Haewol Quarters? Over my dead body! No, we can't let this happen. Chase away the Hoglins so they can never think about settling down there.

18601006.text: Hoglins are threateningly swinging their weapons along the Crimson Forest Path. This is war! We must seize their weapons and neutralize them at once!

18601007.text: The Hoglins are raising Black Bulbaries. For food purposes, maybe? If it is, then we must get rid of their Black Bulbaries. The sooner they run out of food, the sooner they'll leave the Crimson Forest Path.

18601008.text: The Autumn Sunset Valley is infested with so many scorpions that I don't feel safe going there. Please take care of Redtail Scorpions.

18601009.text: Sometimes, even poison can be medicine, right? Maybe that's the case with the scorpions in the Autumn Sunset Valley. Could you bring me venom from Redtail Scorpions and Elite Big Redtail Scorpions? I'd like to see if I can make some medicine with it.

18601010.text: The earlier settlers were so afraid of contracting a disease that they burned old trees. Since then, Maple Tree Spirits appear where their trees used to be. Please help us protect passersby from these spirits.

18601011.text: There are Oduksinis down below the Lumber Camp that give passersby riddles and harass them if they answer wrong. Please silence these mischievous Oduksinis.

18601012.text: Oduksinis have been seen around the Riddle Plain day and night. Please stop them before they reach our settlement.

18601013.text: Ancient Tree Spirits have been appearing at the Riddle Plain. The Oduksinis summoned those spirits to get rid of the settlers. Go to Riddle Plain and eliminate the Ancient Tree Spirits and Oduksinis.

18601014.text: Red Foxes that live near the Lumber Camp have been coming to the Haewol Quarters every night to steal meat. Please eliminate the Red Foxes around the Lumber Camp.

18601015.text: A horde of Mandaravas has shown up at the Lumber Camp. Eliminate them before they fill that place with their noise. They're Gray Mandaravas.

18601016.text: Even Mandaravas should be useful for something. I'm most curious about their stems. I believe there's plenty of nutrition in them, especially at the part where it's pointy like a horn. If you collect the Mandarava stems, I'll request someone who's skilled in botany to do some research on them.

18601017.text: The Shelter of the Forest is the first line of defense of the Ivory Gale Haewol Quarters against the Hollows. We must not be distracted from our guard duties because of those Oduksinis. Go to the Shelter of the Forest and eliminate them.

18601018.text: Well, rumor has it that wearing an Oduksini mask can protect the wearer from Hollows. Can you believe that nonsense? Let's put a stop to that dangerous rumor. Please go to the Shelter of the Forest, eliminate Oduksinis, and destroy their masks.

18601019.text: An Elite Gray Darkhorn has appeared in the Shelter of the Forest. Please drive it away before it attracts other Darkhorns to that place.

18601020.text: Ivory Gale is fighting the Daybreak at the Specter Hill. We must help Ivory Gale, especially since they have a cooperative relationship with both home and Saho. Go quickly and eliminate the Daybreak.

18601021.text: The forces of the Daybreak are growing, and we'll be in trouble if we don't take care of them now. Please eliminate them.

18601022.text: We need an antidote for people who have been poisoned by the Daybreaks. Please collect them from Daybreak Shamans and Elite Daybreak Voodoo Doctors.

18601023.text: The Gray Jungle is teeming with saberfangs whose hair has turned gray from exposure to the energy of Caelite. They're also getting more violent by the day. Please exterminate them for people's safety.

18601024.text: If you're going to the Gray Jungle, please be so kind as to pick up some organs from Caelite-affected saberfangs on your way back. They'll be greatly helpful to my Caelite research.

18601025.text: The Ratmen have appeared at the Gray Jungle. They're just roaming around, their bloodshot eyes looking for prey. Please eliminate the Ratmen in the Gray Jungle.

18601026.text: The Hollows wandering about the Caelite Ruin are poor wretches. They came to Haewol full of hopes and dreams, only to be turned into the monsters that they are now. Please put them out of their misery.

18601027.text: Most people steer clear of the Caelite Ruin. Caelite or not, that place is dangerous because of Hollows. You have to be strong enough to beat those murderous Hollows and take that gigantic Caelite.

18601028.text: There's something special about the weapons of the Hollows at the Caelite Ruin. If you bring those powerful-looking weapons to me, I'll investigate their secrets. It won't be an easy job, but I think you can handle it.

18601029.text: Rumor has it that there's a secret tunnel under the Caelite Excavation Site and it keeps producing Hollows. How terrible! Please go stop the Hollows there.

18601030.text: Caelite dust has been found on some Consumed farmers. We must collect it before they're used for the wrong reason. Please collect their Caelite dust pouches.

18601031.text: The Consumed Soldiers at the Caelite Excavation Site were sacrificed when the Caelite energy exploded there. Could you help them rest in peace? I'll prepare a ritual to appease their spirits.

18601032.text: Specters have been appearing at the Winged Monster Hunting Zone. They seem to be what remains of the monsters killed at the Hideout of Disaster, so I'm worried that these Specters will harm the hunters. Eliminate them.

18601033.text: The Hideout of Disaster is swarming with spiders, but no hunter seems to even take notice of them. All of them want to catch Night Gargoyles for bragging rights. Clearly, they're a selfish bunch. Anyone who's not among them, please exterminate Stealth Spiders.

18601034.text: Many hunters are headed for the Hideout of Disaster to hunt the Night Gargoyles. It's mostly to gain some recognition by hunting multiple Night Gargoyles. Join them if you're confident in your hunting skills.

18601035.text: Good news! The red buds growing on the antlers of Red-Antlered Stags are effective as a pandemic treatment. Please bring Red-Antlered Stag Red Buds to me. I'd like to make a pandemic treatment with them.

18601036.text: The Red Horn Path is crowded with Redhorns, and it's become hard to collect the Red-Antlered Stag's red buds. It'll be helpful if you could eliminate the Redhorns.

18601037.text: The Poacher Gang has appeared inside the Red Horn Path. They've come to poach the Red-Antlered Stags! They must have heard the rumor about their antlers selling for a lot of money. Hurry and chase away the Poacher Gang!

18601038.text: The early pioneers rested while looking at the ethereal-looking Jellyfish in the Dreamy Forest. Those Jellyfish may have been gentle back then, but they're very ferocious now. There's no way you can rest in the midst of those creatures, angrily flapping their arms. We must cull them down if we want to relax as the early pioneers did.

18601039.text: Pioneers are unable to explore the Dreamy Forest because of Confused Dreamy Rocs in there. Please exterminate them and help the pioneers.

18601040.text: The feathers of the Dreamy Rocs are very colorful and fancy. How about using those feathers to decorate some hats? It just might become a specialty of the Caelite Land. I'll try to create a test sample if you bring the feathers.

18601041.text: The Spitting Plants at Gnarlox Forest are changing colors. We need a sample to find out what's going on. It'll be helpful if you could collect some Mutant Spitting Plant samples.

18601042.text: The Gnarloxes in Caelite Land have become all the more dangerous due to their Tectite-induced mutation. Please go to the Gnarlox Forest and exterminate Gnarloxes there.

18601043.text: The Gnarlox Forest is becoming more dangerous because of the Mutant Gnarloxes. Please stop those Mutant Gnarloxes and Elite Mutant Gnarloxes before they consume the whole forest or hurt the settlers there.

18601044.text: Mutant Nepenthes are prevalent in Soaring Rocks. They're a huge threat, and must be contained before it's too late. Please exterminate them.

18601045.text: Flame Plants at the Soaring Rocks are spewing flames at unsuspecting passersby. Please exterminate them so no more people will suffer severe burns.

18601046.text: Tarites are appearing at the Soaring Rock Mountain, and I'm worried they will spread an endemic. Please exterminate the Tarites. That should help prevent an endemic from breaking out.

18601047.text: It's not easy to obtain food at the Caelite Lands that are mostly ruined. We still have to eat, so we've been raising chickens, but that's still not enough meat for all of us. We'll appreciate if you could gather some Goat Meat for us.

18601048.text: There are Soldiers at Soaring Rock Ramp who aren't Hollows, but they seem to have lost their souls. Chase them away so that passerby won't get terrified by them.

18601049.text: What did these mutants wandering about Soaring Rock Ramp used to be? Who were they? Maybe their personal effects can give us some clues. Please bring me Mutant Soldier's or Elite Mutant General's Belongings.

18601050.text: The Bulbari at the Destroyed Rocks have an especially green color. How about we make baskets with them? If you could collect the Bulbari leaves, I'll see if I can create big, durable specialty baskets with them.

18601051.text: We can't travel through the Destroyed Rocks because of the mutants there. Please exterminate Mutant Miners, Watchers, or Overseers at the Destroyed Rocks.

18601052.text: The Blue Bandits have made camp at Dragonhead Cape. Please wipe out those Blue Bandits. The development of Dragonhead Cape is getting delayed because of them.

18601053.text: The Blue Bandits keep raiding the exploration bases at Dragonhead Cape. Please attack the Blue Bandits Hulk and Hercules so that we can have time to create a wall at the Dragonhead Cape Exploration Base.

18601054.text: We need any information we can get about the Mutant Blueskin in the Tectite Valley. Please collect whatever you think might help.

18601055.text: The armed Mutant Blueskins are tough and ferocious. They're blocking the narrow pathway of the Valley and threatening the safety of the pioneers. Eliminate them and secure the pathway.
